Description: Miniature pottery vessel with one vertical handle from the shoulder to the neck of the vessel. Ball-shaped body on low foot. Thin red slip or wash. Red-brown Nile silt with common mica and organic vessicles and rare white inclusions <3.5 mm wide. Grey-brown core. Resinous residue on side by handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Single handled cup-mouuth flagon, with Trajanic or later parallels from Mons Claudianus (Tomber 2006, 52, type 4), also found as Egyptian Red slip.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.03)
